CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two POWERED BY thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO negative two POWERED BY thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND character at position index OF s EQUALS a single whitespace character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (character at position index OF s EQUALS the plus sign OR character at position index OF s EQUALS the minus sign)  
            IF character at position index OF s EQUALS the minus sign  
                SET sign TO negative one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND character at position index OF s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF character at position index OF s  
            IF result GREATER THAN (INT_MAX MINUS digit) DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO the NEGATIVE of two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s EQUALS the space character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (element at position index of s EQUALS the plus character OR element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character)  
            IF element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character  
                SET sign TO the NEGATIVE of one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF element at position index of s  
            IF result GREATER THAN INT_MAX MINUS digit DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string, num2 string) RETURNS string
        IF num1 IS "0" OR num2 IS "0"
            RETURN "0"
        END IF

        DECLARE digits AS MAP from INT to INT
        DECLARE lengthSum AS INT = LENGTH(num1) + LENGTH(num2)
        FOR index IN RANGE(lengthSum)
            digits[index] = 0
        END FOR

        DECLARE reversed1 AS string = ""
        DECLARE reversed2 AS string = ""
        FOR p FROM LENGTH(num1) - 1 DOWNTO 0
            reversed1 = reversed1 + num1[p]
        END FOR
        FOR q FROM LENGTH(num2) - 1 DOWNTO 0
            reversed2 = reversed2 + num2[q]
        END FOR

        DECLARE function recursiveMul(i INT, j INT) RETURNS VOID
            IF i = LENGTH(reversed1)
                RETURN
            END IF
            IF j = LENGTH(reversed2)
                recursiveMul(i + 1, 0)
                RETURN
            END IF

            DECLARE valA AS INT = ASCII_CODE(reversed1[i]) - ASCII_CODE("0")
            DECLARE valB AS INT = ASCII_CODE(reversed2[j]) - ASCII_CODE("0")
            DECLARE product AS INT = valA * valB
            DECLARE baseIndex AS INT = i + j
            DECLARE nextIndex AS INT = baseIndex + 1
            DECLARE totalSum AS INT = product + digits[baseIndex]

            digits[baseIndex] = totalSum MOD 10
            digits[nextIndex] = digits[nextIndex] + (totalSum DIV 10)

            recursiveMul(i, j + 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL recursiveMul(0, 0)

        DECLARE output AS string = ""
        FOR key FROM lengthSum - 1 DOWNTO 0
            output = output + TO_STRING(digits[key])
        END FOR

        WHILE LENGTH(output) > 1 AND output[0] = "0"
            output = SUBSTRING(output, 1)
        END WHILE

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION multiply(num1 string num2 string) RETURNS string  
        IF num1 EQUALS string zero OR num2 EQUALS string zero  
            RETURN string zero  
        END IF  

        SET result TO a list of zeros with the LENGTH OF num1 PLUS the LENGTH OF num2  

        SET num1 TO the reversal of num1  
        SET num2 TO the reversal of num2  

        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num1 MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF num2 MINUS one  
                SET mul TO the character code of the element at position i of num1 MINUS the character code of string zero MULTIPLIED BY the character code of the element at position j of num2 MINUS the character code of string zero  
                SET p1 TO i PLUS j  
                SET p2 TO i PLUS j PLUS one  
                SET sum TO mul PLUS the element at position p1 of result  

                SET the element at position p1 of result TO sum MODULO ten  
                INCREMENT the element at position p2 of result BY the integer division of sum BY ten  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET result_str TO the concatenation of the string representations of the elements of result in reverse order  
        RETURN result_str with all leading string zeros removed  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n IS 0 THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        ASSIGN resultList TO grayCode(n - 1)  
        LET bitFlag BE 2 ^ (n - 1) * 1  
        
        DEFINE FUNCTION reverseList(inputList)  
            IF inputList IS EMPTY THEN  
                RETURN []  
            ELSE  
                RETURN reverseList(inputList[1:]) + [inputList[0]]  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET reversedResult BE reverseList(resultList)  
        LET extendedList BE []  
        
        FOR each element IN reversedResult DO  
            extendedList = extendedList + [(element BITWISE_OR bitFlag)]  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN resultList + extendedList  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero  
            RETURN a list containing zero  
        END IF  
        SET prev_gray TO the result of calling grayCode with the value of n MINUS one  
        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION reverseWords(s)  
        DECLARE wordList AS list  
        wordList ← EMPTY LIST  
        DECLARE index AS INTEGER  
        index ← 0  
        WHILE index < LENGTH(s) DO  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(s) AND s[index] = ' ' DO  
                index ← index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            IF index = LENGTH(s) THEN  
                BREAK  
            END IF  
            DECLARE startPos AS INTEGER  
            startPos ← index  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(s) AND s[index] ≠ ' ' DO  
                index ← index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET word TO SUBSTRING(s, startPos, index - startPos)  
            APPEND word TO wordList  
        END WHILE  
        DECLARE reversedList AS list  
        reversedList ← EMPTY LIST  
        DECLARE pos AS INTEGER  
        pos ← LENGTH(wordList) - 1  
        WHILE pos ≥ 0 DO  
            APPEND wordList[pos] TO reversedList  
            pos ← pos - 1  
        END WHILE  
        DECLARE result AS STRING  
        result ← ""  
        FOR EACH element IN reversedList DO  
            IF result = "" THEN  
                result ← element  
            ELSE  
                result ← result + " " + element  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION bulbSwitch(n)  
        SET rootCandidate TO 1  
        WHILE (rootCandidate + 1) * (rootCandidate + 1) <= n  
            INCREMENT rootCandidate BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN rootCandidate  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)
        ASSIGN amount + 1 TO alpha
        CREATE dp WITH alpha ELEMENTS ALL INITIALIZED TO alpha
        ASSIGN 0 TO dp[0]

        FUNCTION recurBeta(index)
            IF index > amount THEN RETURN END IF

            SET cursor TO 0
            WHILE cursor < LENGTH(coins)
                LET delta = index - coins[cursor]
                IF delta >= 0 THEN
                    LET candidate = dp[delta] + 1
                    IF candidate < dp[index] THEN
                        dp[index] = candidate
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT cursor
            END WHILE

            CALL recurBeta(index + 1)
        END FUNCTION

        CALL recurBeta(1)

        IF dp[amount] != alpha THEN
            RETURN dp[amount]
        END IF

        RETURN -1
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET dp TO a list of amount PLUS one elements each set TO amount PLUS one  
        SET element at position zero of dp TO zero  
        FOR each a FROM one TO amount  
            FOR each coin IN coins  
                IF a MINUS coin IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero  
                    SET dp at position a TO the minimum BETWEEN dp at position a AND dp at position a MINUS coin PLUS one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        IF dp at position amount IS NOT EQUAL TO amount PLUS one  
            RETURN dp at position amount  
        ELSE  
            RETURN minus one  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
  FUNCTION countNumbersWithUniqueDigits(n)
    DECLARE x ARRAY WITH VALUES [0, 10]
    IF n LESS THAN 2 THEN
      RETURN x[n]
    END IF
    DECLARE r TO 10
    DECLARE y TO 9
    DECLARE z TO 9
    DECLARE j TO 2
    WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n
      SET z TO z TIMES y
      SET r TO r PLUS z
      SET y TO y MINUS 1
      SET j TO j PLUS 1
    END WHILE
    RETURN r
  END FUNCTION
END CLASS

true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countNumbersWithUniqueDigits(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero THEN  
            RETURN one  
        END IF  
        IF n EQUALS one THEN  
            RETURN ten  
        END IF  
        SET count TO ten  
        SET available_digits TO nine  
        SET choices TO nine  
        FOR i FROM two TO n INCLUSIVE  
            SET choices TO choices MULTIPLIED BY available_digits  
            SET count TO count PLUS choices  
            SET available_digits TO available_digits MINUS one  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE participantList AS an empty list  
        FUNCTION initializeTeams(current)  
            IF current GREATER THAN n THEN  
                RETURN  
            ELSE  
                APPEND string representation of current TO participantList  
                CALL initializeTeams(current + 1)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        CALL initializeTeams(1)  
        
        FUNCTION pairUp(count)  
            IF count EQUALS 1 THEN  
                RETURN  
            ELSE  
                FOR index FROM 0 TO (count DIV 2) - 1  
                    DECLARE leftTeam AS participantList[index]  
                    DECLARE rightTeam AS participantList[count - 1 - index]  
                    SET participantList[index] TO "(" + leftTeam + "," + rightTeam + ")"  
                END FOR  
                CALL pairUp(count DIV 2)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        CALL pairUp(n)  
        RETURN participantList[0]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        SET teams TO an empty list  
        FOR number FROM one TO n  
            APPEND the string representation of number TO teams  
        END FOR  
        WHILE n GREATER THAN one  
            FOR i FROM zero TO n DIVIDED BY two MINUS one  
                SET teams at position i TO the concatenation of an open parenthesis concatenated with the element at position i of teams concatenated with a comma concatenated with the element at position n MINUS one MINUS i of teams concatenated with a close parenthesis  
            END FOR  
            SET n TO n DIVIDED BY two  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN the element at position zero of teams  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        LET size BE LENGTH OF graph  
        LET marks BE a dictionary WITH KEYS FROM 0 TO size - 1 INITIALIZED TO 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfsCheck(vertex, mark)  
            marks[vertex] = mark  
            LET neighbors BE graph[vertex]  
            
            FOR index FROM LENGTH OF neighbors - 1 DOWNTO 0  
                LET adjacent BE neighbors[index]  
                
                SWITCH marks[adjacent]  
                    CASE mark:  
                        RETURN False  
                    CASE 0:  
                        LET result BE dfsCheck(adjacent, -mark)  
                        IF result == False THEN  
                            RETURN False  
                        END IF  
                END SWITCH  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        LET pos BE 0  
        WHILE pos < size  
            IF marks[pos] == 0 THEN  
                IF NOT dfsCheck(pos, 1) THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            pos = pos + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF graph  
        SET color TO a list of zeros with LENGTH n  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(node c)  
            SET the element at position node of color TO c  
            FOR each neighbor IN the element at position node of graph  
                IF the element at position neighbor of color EQUALS c  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
                IF the element at position neighbor of color EQUALS zero  
                    IF dfs(neighbor the NEGATION OF c) EQUALS False  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF the element at position i of color EQUALS zero  
                IF dfs(i one) EQUALS False  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION racecar(target)
        DECLARE queue AS new empty list
        DECLARE seen AS new empty dictionary
        INSERT [0, 1, 0] AT END OF queue
        MARK key (0, 1) AS true IN seen

        DEFINE FUNCTION explore()
            IF LENGTH OF queue IS ZERO
                RETURN
            END IF

            REMOVE first_element FROM queue
            ASSIGN current_position TO first_element[0]
            ASSIGN current_speed TO first_element[1]
            ASSIGN current_steps TO first_element[2]

            IF current_position = target THEN
                RETURN current_steps
            END IF

            DECLARE position_candidate = current_position + current_speed
            DECLARE speed_candidate = current_speed * 2
            DECLARE key1 = (position_candidate, speed_candidate)

            IF NOT seen CONTAINS key1 AND position_candidate >= 0 AND position_candidate < 2 * target THEN
                MARK key1 AS true IN seen
                APPEND [position_candidate, speed_candidate, current_steps + 1] TO queue
            END IF

            IF current_speed > 0 THEN
                ASSIGN speed_candidate TO -1
            ELSE
                ASSIGN speed_candidate TO 1
            END IF
            DECLARE key2 = (current_position, speed_candidate)

            IF NOT seen CONTAINS key2 AND current_position >= 0 AND current_position < 2 * target THEN
                MARK key2 AS true IN seen
                APPEND [current_position, speed_candidate, current_steps + 1] TO queue
            END IF

            RETURN explore()
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN explore()
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION racecar(target)  
        ASSIGN reference TO a new double ended queue containing a single tuple of zero for position one for speed and zero for steps  
        ASSIGN reference TO a new empty set  
        ADD a tuple of zero for position and one for speed TO the set  
        
        WHILE the queue is not empty  
            REMOVE and ASSIGN a tuple from the left side of the queue TO position speed and steps  
            
            IF position EQUALS target  
                RETURN steps  
            END IF  
            
            SET next_position TO position PLUS speed  
            SET next_speed TO speed MULTIPLIED BY two  
            IF the tuple of next_position and next_speed NOT IN the set AND next_position IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND next_position IS LESS THAN two MULTIPLIED BY target  
                ADD the tuple of next_position and next_speed TO the set  
                APPEND the tuple of next_position next_speed and steps PLUS one TO the right side of the queue  
            END IF  
            
            IF speed IS GREATER THAN zero  
                SET next_speed TO negative one  
            ELSE  
                SET next_speed TO one  
            END IF  
            IF the tuple of position and next_speed NOT IN the set AND position IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND position IS LESS THAN two MULTIPLIED BY target  
                ADD the tuple of position and next_speed TO the set  
                APPEND the tuple of position next_speed and steps PLUS one TO the right side of the queue  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET same TO empty set  
        FOR each pair x, y IN zipped fronts AND backs  
            IF x EQUALS y  
                ADD x TO same  
        SET all_numbers TO set of all elements IN fronts PLUS backs  
        SET good_numbers TO all_numbers MINUS same  
        IF good_numbers IS NOT empty  
            RETURN minimum value IN good_numbers  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET same TO empty set  
        FOR each pair of front_card AND back_card IN fronts AND backs simultaneously  
            IF front_card EQUALS back_card  
                ADD front_card TO same  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET all_numbers TO empty set  
        FOR each number IN fronts  
            ADD number TO all_numbers  
        END FOR  
        FOR each number IN backs  
            ADD number TO all_numbers  
        END FOR  
        SET good_numbers TO empty set  
        FOR each number IN all_numbers  
            IF number NOT IN same  
                ADD number TO good_numbers  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF the LENGTH OF good_numbers IS GREATER THAN zero  
            SET minimum_good_number TO the smallest element IN good_numbers  
            RETURN minimum_good_number  
        ELSE  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET directions TO list CONTAINING tuple zero zero and zero negative one and one zero and negative one zero  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF grid  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        SET start TO no value  
        SET num_keys TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO m MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid THEN element at position j EQUALS at symbol  
                    SET start TO tuple i and j  
                ELSE IF element at position i of grid THEN element at position j IS lowercase letter  
                    INCREMENT num_keys BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        INITIALIZE queue AS a double ended queue CONTAINING tuple element at position zero of start and element at position one of start and zero and zero  
        INITIALIZE visited AS a set CONTAINING tuple element at position zero of start and element at position one of start and zero  
        WHILE queue IS NOT empty  
            REMOVE and RETURN leftmost element OF queue INTO x and y and keys and steps  
            FOR each tuple dx and dy IN directions  
                SET nx TO x PLUS dx  
                SET ny TO y PLUS dy  
                IF nx IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND nx IS LESS THAN m AND ny IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND ny IS LESS THAN n  
                    SET cell TO element at position nx of grid THEN element at position ny  
                    IF cell EQUALS hash symbol  
                        CONTINUE TO next iteration  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS uppercase letter  
                        SET key_needed TO one LEFT SHIFTED BY the alphabetic position of lowercase version of cell MINUS the alphabetic position of lowercase letter a  
                        IF keys AND key_needed EQUALS zero  
                            CONTINUE TO next iteration  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS lowercase letter  
                        SET new_keys TO keys OR one LEFT SHIFTED BY the alphabetic position of cell MINUS the alphabetic position of lowercase letter a  
                        IF new_keys EQUALS one LEFT SHIFTED BY num_keys MINUS one  
                            RETURN steps PLUS one  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET new_keys TO keys  
                    END IF  
                    IF tuple nx and ny and new_keys IS NOT IN visited  
                        ADD tuple nx and ny and new_keys TO visited  
                        APPEND tuple nx and ny and new_keys and steps PLUS one TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET directions TO the list of pairs representing movement right one step left one step down one step and up one step  
        SET m TO the LENGTH OF grid  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        SET start TO no value assigned  
        SET num_keys TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the value m MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM zero TO the value n MINUS one  
                IF element at position i of grid at position j EQUALS the character at sign at symbol  
                    SET start TO the pair of values i and j  
                ELSE IF element at position i of grid at position j IS a lowercase letter  
                    INCREMENT num_keys BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET queue TO a new double ended queue containing the single element of the tuple of value at position zero of start value at position one of start zero zero  
        SET visited TO a new set containing the single element of the tuple of value at position zero of start value at position one of start zero  
        WHILE queue is not empty  
            SET x y keys steps TO the tuple removed from the front of queue  
            FOR each pair dx dy IN directions  
                SET nx TO x PLUS dx  
                SET ny TO y PLUS dy  
                IF nx IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND nx IS LESS THAN m AND ny IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND ny IS LESS THAN n  
                    SET cell TO element at position nx of grid at position ny  
                    IF cell EQUALS the hash symbol  
                        CONTINUE to next iteration of FOR loop  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS an uppercase letter  
                        SET key_needed TO one SHIFTED LEFT BY the Unicode code point of the lowercase form of cell MINUS the Unicode code point of letter a  
                        IF the result of keys AND key_needed EQUALS zero  
                            CONTINUE to next iteration of FOR loop  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF cell IS a lowercase letter  
                        SET new_keys TO the result of keys OR one SHIFTED LEFT BY the Unicode code point of cell MINUS the Unicode code point of letter a  
                        IF new_keys EQUALS one SHIFTED LEFT BY num_keys MINUS one  
                            RETURN steps PLUS one  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET new_keys TO keys  
                    END IF  
                    IF the tuple nx ny new_keys IS NOT in visited  
                        ADD the tuple nx ny new_keys TO visited  
                        APPEND the tuple nx ny new_keys steps PLUS one TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canConvert WITH PARAMETERS str1 str2  
        SET index TO 0  
        WHILE TRUE  
            IF index GREATER OR EQUAL TO LENGTH(str1)  
                BREAK  
            END IF  
            IF str1[index] NOT EQUALS str2[index]  
                EXIT WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET index TO index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        IF index GREATER OR EQUAL TO LENGTH(str1)  
            RETURN True  
        END IF  

        SET char_mappings TO EMPTY_MAP  
        SET pos TO 0  
        WHILE pos LESS THAN LENGTH(str1)  
            SET first_char TO str1[pos]  
            SET second_char TO str2[pos]  
            IF first_char IN KEYS(char_mappings)  
                IF char_mappings[first_char] IS NOT second_char  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN char_mappings[first_char] ← second_char  
            END IF  
            SET pos TO pos + 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET unique_targets TO EMPTY_SET  
        FOR EACH character IN str2  
            ADD character TO unique_targets  
        END FOR  
        IF LENGTH(unique_targets) EQUALS 26  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  

        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canConvert WITH PARAMETERS str1 str2  
        IF str1 EQUALS str2  
            RETURN True  
        END IF  
        SET conversion_map TO an empty mapping from characters to characters  
        FOR each pair of characters char1 and char2 FROM str1 AND str2 in order  
            IF char1 IS IN conversion_map  
                IF the value mapped from char1 in conversion_map NOT EQUALS char2  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                SET the value mapped from char1 in conversion_map TO char2  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF the number of unique characters IN str2 EQUALS twenty six  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION cherryPickup(grid)  
        SET rows TO LENGTH OF grid  
        SET cols TO LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX 0  
        
        FUNCTION dp(r, c1, c2)  
            IF c1 LESS THAN 0 OR c1 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols OR c2 LESS THAN 0 OR c2 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols THEN  
                RETURN 0  
            END IF  
            
            IF c1 EQUALS c2 THEN  
                SET cherries TO grid AT INDEX r AND c1  
            ELSE  
                SET cherries TO grid AT INDEX r AND c1 PLUS grid AT INDEX r AND c2  
            END IF  
            
            IF r EQUALS rows MINUS 1 THEN  
                RETURN cherries  
            END IF  
            
            SET max_cherries TO 0  
            FOR EACH dc1 IN LIST OF -1, 0, 1  
                FOR EACH dc2 IN LIST OF -1, 0, 1  
                    SET candidate TO dp(r PLUS 1, c1 PLUS dc1, c2 PLUS dc2)  
                    IF candidate GREATER THAN max_cherries THEN  
                        SET max_cherries TO candidate  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN cherries PLUS max_cherries  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dp(0, 0, cols MINUS 1)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION cherryPickup(grid)  
        SET rows TO the LENGTH OF grid  
        SET cols TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of grid  
        
        FUNCTION dp(r c1 c2)  
            IF c1 LESS THAN zero OR c1 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols OR c2 LESS THAN zero OR c2 GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO cols THEN  
                RETURN zero  
            END IF  
            
            IF c1 EQUALS c2 THEN  
                SET cherries TO element at position r of grid element at position c1  
            ELSE  
                SET cherries TO element at position r of grid element at position c1 PLUS element at position r of grid element at position c2  
            END IF  
            
            IF r EQUALS rows MINUS one THEN  
                RETURN cherries  
            END IF  
            
            SET max_cherries TO zero  
            FOR each dc1 IN list containing negative one zero and one  
                FOR each dc2 IN list containing negative one zero and one  
                    SET possible TO dp(r PLUS one c1 PLUS dc1 c2 PLUS dc2)  
                    IF possible GREATER THAN max_cherries THEN  
                        SET max_cherries TO possible  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            
            RETURN cherries PLUS max_cherries  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN dp(zero zero cols MINUS one)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDifference(nums AS List OF Integer) RETURNS Integer  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF nums DIVIDED BY two  
        SET total_sum TO the SUM OF all elements IN nums  
        SET target TO total_sum DIVIDED BY two  
        SET min_diff TO positive infinity  
          
        SET left_half TO the SUBLIST OF nums FROM the first element TO element at position n minus one  
        SET right_half TO the SUBLIST OF nums FROM element at position n TO the LAST element  
          
        SET left_sums TO a new LIST containing n PLUS one EMPTY MAPPINGS  
        SET right_sums TO a new LIST containing n PLUS one EMPTY MAPPINGS  
          
        FOR each integer i FROM zero TO n INCLUSIVE  
            FOR each combination combo OF size i TAKEN FROM left_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF all elements IN combo  
                IF subset_sum NOT IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums THEN  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums BY one  
            END FOR  
              
            FOR each combination combo OF size i TAKEN FROM right_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF all elements IN combo  
                IF subset_sum NOT IN the mapping at position i OF right_sums THEN  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF right_sums TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN the mapping at position i OF right_sums BY one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
          
        FOR each integer i FROM zero TO n INCLUSIVE  
            SET left_values TO the SORTED LIST OF all keys IN the mapping at position i OF left_sums  
            SET right_values TO the SORTED LIST OF all keys IN the mapping at position n MINUS i OF right_sums  
              
            SET j TO zero  
            SET k TO the LENGTH OF right_values MINUS one  
            WHILE j LESS THAN the LENGTH OF left_values AND k GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero  
                SET current_sum TO the element at position j OF left_values PLUS the element at position k OF right_values  
                SET candidate_diff TO total_sum MINUS two TIMES current_sum  
                IF candidate_diff LESS THAN zero THEN  
                    SET candidate_diff TO the NEGATIVE of candidate_diff  
                END IF  
                IF candidate_diff LESS THAN min_diff THEN  
                    SET min_diff TO candidate_diff  
                END IF  
                  
                IF current_sum LESS THAN target THEN  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                ELSE IF current_sum GREATER THAN target THEN  
                    DECREMENT k BY one  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN zero  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
        END FOR  
          
        RETURN min_diff  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDifference(nums)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF nums DIVIDED BY two  
        SET total_sum TO the SUM OF nums  
        SET target TO total_sum DIVIDED BY two  
        SET min_diff TO positive infinity  
        
        SET left_half TO the first n elements of nums  
        SET right_half TO the elements of nums from position n plus one TO the end  
        
        SET left_sums TO a list containing empty dictionaries repeated n PLUS one times  
        SET right_sums TO a list containing empty dictionaries repeated n PLUS one times  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n  
            FOR each combination of i elements IN left_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF the current combination  
                IF subset_sum EXISTS AS A KEY IN left_sums at position i  
                    DO NOTHING  
                ELSE  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN left_sums at position i TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN left_sums at position i BY one  
            END FOR  
            
            FOR each combination of i elements IN right_half  
                SET subset_sum TO the SUM OF the current combination  
                IF subset_sum EXISTS AS A KEY IN right_sums at position i  
                    DO NOTHING  
                ELSE  
                    SET the value at key subset_sum IN right_sums at position i TO zero  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT the value at key subset_sum IN right_sums at position i BY one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n  
            SET left_values TO the keys of left_sums at position i SORTED in ascending order  
            SET right_values TO the keys of right_sums at position n MINUS i SORTED in ascending order  
            
            SET j TO zero  
            SET k TO the LENGTH OF right_values MINUS one  
            
            WHILE j LESS THAN the LENGTH OF left_values AND k GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero  
                SET current_sum TO the element at position j of left_values PLUS the element at position k of right_values  
                SET diff_candidate TO total_sum MINUS two MULTIPLIED BY current_sum  
                IF diff_candidate IS LESS THAN zero  
                    SET diff_candidate TO the NEGATIVE of diff_candidate  
                END IF  
                IF diff_candidate LESS THAN min_diff  
                    SET min_diff TO diff_candidate  
                END IF  
                
                IF current_sum LESS THAN target  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                ELSE IF current_sum GREATER THAN target  
                    DECREMENT k BY one  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN zero  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN min_diff  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findDerangement(n)  
        DEFINE modulus = 10^9 + 7  
        
        FUNCTION calc(k, val1, val2)  
            IF k > n THEN  
                RETURN val2  
            ELSE  
                SET temp = (k - 1) * (val1 + val2)  
                SET temp = temp MOD modulus  
                RETURN calc(k + 1, val2, temp)  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        IF n == 1 THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        IF n == 2 THEN  
            RETURN 1  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN calc(3, 0, 1)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findDerangement(n)  
        SET MODULO TO ten RAISED TO THE POWER OF nine PLUS seven  
        
        IF n EQUALS one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        IF n EQUALS two  
            RETURN one  
        END IF  
        
        SET previous_twice TO one  
        SET previous_once TO zero  
        
        FOR integer i FROM three TO n  
            SET current_value TO integer i MINUS one MULTIPLIED BY the SUM OF previous_once AND previous_twice  
            SET current_value TO current_value MODULO MODULO  
            SET previous_twice TO previous_once  
            SET previous_once TO current_value  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN previous_once  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
